tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE joint_movements_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  x_coordinate FLOAT,
  y_coordinate FLOAT,
  z_coordinate FLOAT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE JointMovementsData (
    participant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    joint_name VARCHAR(50),
    x_coordinate FLOAT,
    y_coordinate FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE movements_data (
    movement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    movement_name VARCHAR(255),
    movement_type VARCHAR(50),
    recorded_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE user_data (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_name VARCHAR(255),
    age INT,
    weight DECIMAL(5,2),
    height DECIMAL(5,2)
);

CREATE TABLE analysis_results (
    result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    movement_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    analysis_date DATE,
    analysis_result JSON
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    age INT
)

CREATE TABLE motions (
    motion_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    motion_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE joint_data (
    data_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id UUID REFERENCES users(user_id),
    motion_id UUID REFERENCES motions(motion_id),
    joint_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    joint_angle FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE analysis_results (
    result_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id UUID REFERENCES users(user_id),
    motion_id UUID REFERENCES motions(motion_id),
    analysis_date DATE,
    result TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE joint_movements_data (
    id INT,
    participant_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    joint_name VARCHAR,
    x_position FLOAT,
    y_position FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE motion_analysis_studies (
    id INT,
    study_name VARCHAR,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE test_results (
    result_id INT,
    study_id INT,
    participant_id INT,
    motion_quality VARCHAR,
    duration_seconds INT
);
